snippet: The chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, Thomas F. Prendergast, said the agency’s ambitions for wireless service went beyond station platforms, but questions remain.
abstract: Metropolitan Transportation Authority chairman Thomas F Prendergast says MTA hopes to add Wi-Fi and possibly cellphone reception aboard moving trains, in what appears to be first public acknowledgment that its ambitions for wireless service go beyond stations.
lead_paragraph: The chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority, Thomas F. Prendergast, said the agency’s ambitions for wireless service went beyond station platforms, but questions remain.

headline.main: Wi-Fi and Cellphone Service on Subway Trains? M.T.A. Leader Says It May Happen
headline.print_headline: Wi-Fi and Cellphone Service on Subway Trains? M.T.A. Leader Says It May Happen
